title: `cast` fails to decode calldata blob
body:
### Component

Cast

### Have you ensured that all of these are up to date?

- [X] Foundry
- [X] Foundryup

### What version of Foundry are you on?

forge 0.2.0 (7bba788 2023-05-10T00:07:19.521959963Z)

### What command(s) is the bug in?

cast --abi-decode "(uint112,uint112,uint32)" 0x645aff8b000000000004e7bf82165aab10e90060379f76d5b5f22cdfa046a9a5

### Operating System

Linux

### Describe the bug

```
$ cast --abi-decode "(uint112,uint112,uint32)" 0x645aff8b000000000004e7bf82165aab10e90060379f76d5b5f22cdfa046a9a5
The application panicked (crashed).
Message:  could not convert (uint112,uint112,uint32) to function
Location: common/src/abi.rs:230

This is a bug. Consider reporting it at https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry

Backtrace omitted. Run with RUST_BACKTRACE=1 environment variable to display it.
Run with RUST_BACKTRACE=full to include source snippets.
Aborted
$ RUST_BACKTRACE=full cast --abi-decode "(uint112,uint112,uint32)" 0x645aff8b000000000004e7bf82165aab10e90060379f76d5b5f22cdfa046a9a5
The application panicked (crashed).
Message:  could not convert (uint112,uint112,uint32) to function
Location: common/src/abi.rs:230

This is a bug. Consider reporting it at https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry

  ━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━ BACKTRACE ━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━
   1: __libc_start_main<unknown>
      at ./csu/../csu/libc-start.c:308

Run with COLORBT_SHOW_HIDDEN=1 environment variable to disable frame filtering.
Aborted
```

`cast --abi-decode` does not decode calldata by default. To decode calldata, you need to include the `--input` flag. Also, the signature provided should be a full function signature, which I think is the specific problem that causes the "Message:  could not convert (uint112,uint112,uint32) to function" message. I also don't believe that calldata blob is valid. It would need to include 3*32 = 96 bytes but only seems to include 28.
